snippet: Political leaders in Europe need to admit their countries’ complicity in the financial crisis and tell their citizens the hard truths about what it will take to dig out.
abstract: Editorial criticizes German leaders for insisting that Greece and other indebted economies need to pay for their profligate spending; notes, in many ways, rescue of the Greek economy is a rescue for German banks; urges European leaders to admit to their countries' complicity in the financial crisis and to tell their citizens the hard truths about what it will take to fix the problem.
lead_paragraph: Political leaders in Europe need to admit their countries’ complicity in the financial crisis and tell their citizens the hard truths about what it will take to dig out.
